Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Barack Obama signed an executive order banning all fake news outlets.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or official statement provided to verify the existence of the executive order.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the executive order banning fake news outlets was a response to the controversy surrounding the 2016 presidential election, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no executive order signed by President Obama with the number "Executive Order 13749" or any executive order specifically targeting fake news outlets.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists, as the claim is based on a hoax news article published by a disreputable website, suggesting that the claim itself is false.
